derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French carrousel, from Italian carosello

entry.def: At an airport, a carousel is a moving surface from which passengers can collect their luggage.
A carousel is a large circular machine with seats, often in the shape of animals or cars. People can sit on it and go round and round for fun.

means.word_mean: 2. large mechanical apparatus with seats for children to ride on
